title: How to Make Cheesecake Stuffed Dark Chocolate Cake

steps.headline: Combine the cake mix, milk, oil, instant pudding mix, eggs, chocolate extract, vanilla extract, and almond extract in a large bowl.
steps.description: Mix with an electric mixer for a minute at a low speed. Turn the mixer on a medium speed and beat for 2 additional minutes.

steps.headline: Use a rubber spatula to manually fold in the chopped milk chocolate bars.
Grease the cake pans and then lightly dust the bottoms with cocoa.
Place the pans in the oven for about 32 minutes or when the cakes "spring back" when you lightly touch them.
Leave the cakes to cool for about 10 minutes.
steps.description: Carefully remove the cakes from the pans and use cooling racks to let them cool completely.

steps.headline: Wrap each cake in plastic wrap and place them in the refrigerator between 1 to 24 hours.
Slice each cake into half horizontally with a serrated knife.
steps.description: You'll get four layers out of this.

steps.headline: Create the layered cake.
steps.description: Take a layer and place it on a cake plate. Use a rubber spatula to frost about 1/2 cup of the cream cheese frosting on it. Sprinkle about 1/4 of the cheesecake bites evenly all over the frosting. Place another cake layer on top and repeat the steps with the frosting and cheesecake bites. Don't use cheesecake bites on top of the top layer.

steps.headline: Decorate the top of the cake.
steps.description: Use about 3/4 cup (or more if needed) of frosting to frost the top layer and all around the sides of the cake.

steps.headline: Drizzle and drop caramel sauce all over your cake.
steps.description: Let it drip down the sides for a more heavenly look. Place a few rolled wafer cookies in the middle of the cake and sprinkle the top layer (and sides) with cheesecake bites.

steps.headline: Place the cake in the refrigerator and let it chill until it's ready to be served.

text: Pre-heat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Combine the cake mix, milk, oil, instant pudding mix, eggs, chocolate extract, vanilla extract, and almond extract in a large bowl. Mix with an electric mixer for a minute at a low speed. Turn the mixer on a medium speed and beat for 2 additional minutes. Use a rubber spatula to manually fold in the chopped milk chocolate bars.  Grease the cake pans and then lightly dust the bottoms with cocoa.  Place the pans in the oven for about 32 minutes or when the cakes "spring back" when you lightly touch them.  Leave the cakes to cool for about 10 minutes. Carefully remove the cakes from the pans and use cooling racks to let them cool completely. Wrap each cake in plastic wrap and place them in the refrigerator between 1 to 24 hours.  Slice each cake into half horizontally with a serrated knife. You'll get four layers out of this. Create the layered cake. Take a layer and place it on a cake plate. Use a rubber spatula to frost about 1/2 cup of the cream cheese frosting on it. Sprinkle about 1/4 of the cheesecake bites evenly all over the frosting. Place another cake layer on top and repeat the steps with the frosting and cheesecake bites. Don't use cheesecake bites on top of the top layer. Decorate the top of the cake. Use about 3/4 cup (or more if needed) of frosting to frost the top layer and all around the sides of the cake. Drizzle and drop caramel sauce all over your cake. Let it drip down the sides for a more heavenly look. Place a few rolled wafer cookies in the middle of the cake and sprinkle the top layer (and sides) with cheesecake bites. Place the cake in the refrigerator and let it chill until it's ready to be served.
